DataElement.preferredName: Recurrence Disease Progression Neoplasm Other Surgery Descriptive Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text to describe a new tumor event surgical procedure that is different than previously identified choices.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Recurrence Disease Progression Neoplasm Secondary Other Surgery
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Affecting only a restricted part or area of the body._To occur again._The worsening of a disease over time._(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth._Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value._A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: To occur again.:Cancer that continues to grow or spread.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Concepts.definition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value.:Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.

Concepts.definition: Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The text that provides a description of a topic.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
